unicode.value: Unidad didáctica "The Universe" dirigida a alumnado de segundo curso de educación primaria en el área de Ciencias Sociales en Inglés.

The majority of a learning resource will be establishing context, delivering instructions and providing general information. This provides the framework within which the learning activities are built and delivered.

Por Diana García Pozuelo

The majority of a learning resource will be establishing context, delivering instructions and providing general information. This provides the framework within which the learning activities are built and delivered.
Use this field to enter text. This iDevice has no emphasis applied although limited formatting can be applied to text through the text editing buttons associated with the field.

La siguiente Unidad Didáctica está dirigida a un grupo de alumnos concreto de segundo curso de educación primaria en el área de Ciencias Sociales y está pensada para realizarse a lo largo de 7 sesiones. Los contenidos  se explicarán en inglés de forma presencial.

The majority of a learning resource will be establishing context, delivering instructions and providing general information. This provides the framework within which the learning activities are built and delivered.
Use this field to enter text. This iDevice has no emphasis applied although limited formatting can be applied to text through the text editing buttons associated with the field.

The majority of a learning resource will be establishing context, delivering instructions and providing general information. This provides the framework within which the learning activities are built and delivered.
Use this field to enter text. This iDevice has no emphasis applied although limited formatting can be applied to text through the text editing buttons associated with the field.

Conocer los elementos del sistema Solar. Movimientos de rotación y traslación y su relación con la sucesión del día y la noche y del cambio estacional. Fases de la luna.

Esforzarse. Constancia y hábitos de trabajo. Aplicar estrategias de aprendizaje cooperativo. Buscar orientación o ayuda cuando la necesita.

Imaginar proyectos individuales o colectivos y planificación. Organizar un proyecto con ayuda guiada.

The majority of a learning resource will be establishing context, delivering instructions and providing general information. This provides the framework within which the learning activities are built and delivered.
Use this field to enter text. This iDevice has no emphasis applied although limited formatting can be applied to text through the text editing buttons associated with the field.

- The Earth and the Sun.

- Day and night

- The four seasons

- Moon and its movements

- The Solar System

The majority of a learning resource will be establishing context, delivering instructions and providing general information. This provides the framework within which the learning activities are built and delivered.
Use this field to enter text. This iDevice has no emphasis applied although limited formatting can be applied to text through the text editing buttons associated with the field.

Actividades guiadas dado el idioma a partir del aprendizaje cooperativo y con actividades más manipulativas y experienciales que ayuden a adquirir los conocimientos. Asimismo, las actividades están planteadas para desarrollar (a contribuir a ello) las 4 habilidades básicas: Reading, listening, writing and speaking.

The majority of a learning resource will be establishing context, delivering instructions and providing general information. This provides the framework within which the learning activities are built and delivered.
Use this field to enter text. This iDevice has no emphasis applied although limited formatting can be applied to text through the text editing buttons associated with the field.

Se tendrá en cuenta la participación en el aula y la realización de las actividades, así como la actitud mostrada en clase y la nota de la prueba individual escrita de acuerdo a los indicadores de logro.

The majority of a learning resource will be establishing context, delivering instructions and providing general information. This provides the framework within which the learning activities are built and delivered.
Use this field to enter text. This iDevice has no emphasis applied although limited formatting can be applied to text through the text editing buttons associated with the field.

Indicadores de logro según el Decreto 108/2014 de 4 de julio. (CV)

BL2.1.1. Identifica los elementos del Sistema Solar como parte del Universo a partir de representaciones virtuales o simulaciones.

BL2.1.2. Describe los movimientos de la Tierra sobre su eje inclinado y alrededor del Sol relacionándolo con la sucesión del día y la noche y los cambios estacionales a partir de representaciones virtuales o simulaciones.

BL1.6.1. Sigue las instrucciones para realizar una actividad de aprendizaje sencilla con atención y constancia.

BL1.6.2. Pide ayuda al adulto o a sus compañeros/as cuando la necesita y no abandona cuando le cuesta realizar una actividad.

BL1.7.1. Reconoce si ha seguido correctamente los pasos para el desarrollo de un producto o una tarea planificada de forma colectiva.

Use this field to enter text. This iDevice has no emphasis applied although limited formatting can be applied to text through the text editing buttons associated with the field.

Dado la variedad de discentes, contamos con la disposición de aula y la posición del alumnado para mejorar su aprendizaje, así como reforzar en positivo, disponer de una hoja de seguimiento de las sesiones y el libro del tutor.

The majority of a learning resource will be establishing context, delivering instructions and providing general information. This provides the framework within which the learning activities are built and delivered.
Use this field to enter text. This iDevice has no emphasis applied although limited formatting can be applied to text through the text editing buttons associated with the field.

The Sun

The Sun is a star and it is at the centre of the Solar System. The Sun is important to us because it gives us heat and energy that allows life.





The Earth 

The Earth has a lot of water (75%) and its divided between oceans, seas, rivers and lakes. The remaining 25% is land distributed between continents and islands. The Earth colour seen from the space is blue, due to the sea water.

Because of its water, Earth is home to millions of species of plants and animals.
Provide instruction on how the True/False Question should be completed.
Enter any feedback you wish to provide to the learner. This field may be left blank. if this field is left blank default feedback will be provided.
A hint may be provided to assist the learner in answering the question.

True/false questions present a statement where the learner must decide if the statement is true. This type of question works well for factual information and information that lends itself to either/or responses.
Type the question stem. The question should be clear and unambiguous. Avoid negative premises as these can tend to be ambiguous.
Escriba la pregunta. La pregunta debe ser clara y no ambigua. Evite las premisas negativas ya que esta tienden a ser ambiguas.

Introduzca la retroalimentación que quiere que vean los estudiantes después de haber intentado completar la actividad. Este campo se puede dejar vacío. Si este campo está vacío se ofrecerá la retroalimentación por defecto.
Se puede proporcionar una pista para ayudar al estudiante a responder la pregunta.

The majority of a learning resource will be establishing context, delivering instructions and providing general information. This provides the framework within which the learning activities are built and delivered.
Use this field to enter text. This iDevice has no emphasis applied although limited formatting can be applied to text through the text editing buttons associated with the field.

The Earth moves on an axis. This movement is called rotation and is the reason because we have day and night. On the side of the Earth facing the Sun it is day, and on the other side it is night. The Earth takes 24 hours to complete one day-night cycle.

This is a native explanation
Provide instruction on how the cloze activity should be completed. Default text will be entered if there are no changes to this field.
A number of words have been removed. Remember and fill the gaps.
If this option is checked, submitted answers with different capitalization will be marked as incorrect.
The Earth moves on an axis . This movement is called rotation . When the Earth face the Sun it is day . The Earth takes 24 hours to complete one day-night cycle.
If this option is set, each word will be marked as the learner types it rather than all the words being marked the end of the exercise.

Enter the text for the cloze activity in to the cloze field by either pasting text from another source or by typing text directly into the field.

To select words to hide, double click on the word to select it and click on the Hide/Show Word button below.

More than one possible answer can be defined enclosing them with pipes (|). I.e.: |dog|cat|bird|

If left unchecked a small number of spelling and capitalization errors will be accepted. If checked only an exact match in spelling and capitalization will be accepted.

For example: If the correct answer is Elephant then both elephant and Eliphant will be judged "close enough" by the algorithm as it only has one letter wrong, even if "Check Capitalization" is on.

If capitalization checking is off in the above example, the lowercase e will not be considered a mistake and eliphant will also be accepted.

If both "Strict Marking" and "Check Capitalization" are set, the only correct answer is "Elephant". If only "Strict Marking" is checked and "Check Capitalization" is not, "elephant" will also be accepted.
The Earth moves on an axis. This movement is called rotation. When the Earth face the Sun it is day. The Earth takes 24 hours to complete one day-night cycle.
. When the Earth face the Sun it is
hours to complete one day-night cycle.

Cloze exercises are texts or sentences where students must fill in missing words. They are often used for the following purposes:

  1. To check knowledge of core course concepts (this could be a pre-check, formative exercise, or summative check).
  2. To check reading comprehension.
  3. To check vocabulary knowledge.
  4. To check word formation and/or grammatical competence.

If your goal is to test understanding of core concepts or reading comprehension

Write a summary of the concept or reading long enough to adequately test the target's knowledge, but short enough not to induce fatigue. Less than one typed page is probably adequate, but probably considerably less for young students or beginners.

Select words in the text thatare key to understanding the concepts. Thesewill probably be verbs, nouns, and key adverbs.Choose alternatives with one clear answer.

If your goal is to test vocabulary knowledge

Write a text using the target vocabulary. This text should be coherent and cohesive, and be of an appropriate length. Highlight the target words in the text. Choose alternatives with one clear answer.

If your goal is to test word formation/grammar:

Write a text using the target forms. This text should be coherent and cohesive, and be of an appropriate length. Remember that the goal is not vocabulary knowledge, so the core meanings of the stem words should be well known to the students.

Highlight the target words in the text. Provide alternatives with the same word stem, but different affixes. It is a good idea to get a colleague to test the test/exercise to make sure there are no surprises!
Enter any feedback you wish to provide the learner with-in the feedback field. This field can be left blank.
The Earth moves on an axis. This movement is called rotation. When the Earth face the Sun it is day. The Earth takes 24 hours to complete one day-night cycle.

abcdefghijklmnñopqrstuvwxyz

Movement of the Earth around the Sun
UmV2b2x1dGlvbg==

Por favor active JavaScript para poder jugar a este juego.

The Earth moves around the Sun. This is called revolution. The Earth takes one year to complete one revolution around the Sun.

Because of that, there are four seasons: spring, summer, autumm and winter. Summer is a warm season because the days are longer and Winter is a cold season because the days are shorter.

Use this field to enter text. This iDevice has no emphasis applied although limited formatting can be applied to text through the text editing buttons associated with the field.

A satellite is an object that moves around a planet or a star. The Moon is Earth's largest natural satellite, and we usually see it in the night sky.

Some other planets also have moons or natural satellites.

The Sun iluminates the Moon, which looks as if it is changing shape. These different shapes are called the phases of the moon. It takes the Moon about 29 days to complete the cycle.

The majority of a learning resource will be establishing context, delivering instructions and providing general information. This provides the framework within which the learning activities are built and delivered.
Use this field to enter text. This iDevice has no emphasis applied although limited formatting can be applied to text through the text editing buttons associated with the field.

Oreo Moon phases

Example:

This is your own sheet. You have to:

  1. Separate the two halves of the cookie by twisting them.
  2. Use the "knife" to shape the icing in the shape of the phases of the moon
  3. Place cookies over the spots in the worksheet.
  4. Show to your teacher
  5. Eat them.

Enjoy and have fun.

The majority of a learning resource will be establishing context, delivering instructions and providing general information. This provides the framework within which the learning activities are built and delivered.
Use this field to enter text. This iDevice has no emphasis applied although limited formatting can be applied to text through the text editing buttons associated with the field.

Planets are big balls of rock or gas that move around stars.

All the planets, asteroids and comets move around the Sun.This movement is called revolution. There are eight planets in the Solar System: Mercury, Venus, Earth, Mars, Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, and Neptune.

The Earth takes 365 days, or one year, to complete one revolution around the Sun.

The majority of a learning resource will be establishing context, delivering instructions and providing general information. This provides the framework within which the learning activities are built and delivered.
Use this field to enter text. This iDevice has no emphasis applied although limited formatting can be applied to text through the text editing buttons associated with the field.

Speaking activity. Solar System model.

Follow the instructions to make your Solar System model.

  • Take the planets worksheet and write the name of the planets in one side.
  • Colour  the planets and cuts out the base and the planets. 
  • Attach the planets to the base using pieces of wool.

Now, present your Solar System model to the class. For example, respond to these questions.

Which planet is blue?

Which is your favourite planet?

Was it difficult to make?
